channel.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [ERI1][Hosted Private Cloud] -E104B01/E104B02
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 2, 08:00 - 09:00 UTC

Jan 17, 22:13 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 02/02/2023 08:00 UTC 
End time : 02/02/2023 09:00 UTC
Service impact : Racks E104B01 and E104B02 will be temporarily unreachable for 30 minutes during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our infrastructure, we will be doing electrical works on racks E104B01 and E104B02.

Jan 18, 20:07 UTC

item.title: [RBX8][Hosted Private Cloud] - R808R26/R808R27
item.description:
Jan 13, 14:40 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 13/01/2023 10:44 UTC
End Time : 13/01/2023 13:15 UTC
Technical impact (DC/geographical area) : RBX8
Root cause : Maintenance link that caused an electrical issue. All services are operational since 13:15 UTC.

Jan 13, 13:47 UTC
Update - Ongoing actions : Following the implementation of this maintenance: Maintenance link
an electrical problem has occurred which caused the servers in racks R808R26 and R808R27 temporarily unreachable.
Our teams are working on this issue

Jan 13, 13:01 UTC
Identified - Start time : 13/01/2023 10:44 UTC
Service impact : Servers are temporarily unavailable in racks R808R26 and R808R27
Root cause : Electrical issue
Ongoing actions :Our teams are currently working to solve the problem

item.title: [Global][VMware] - VMware Remote Console
item.description:
Jan 16, 03:35 UTC
Update - The solution we were working on is now being deployed progressively on all infrastructures as part of our usual & automatic upgrade process.
In the meantime, you can still use the "Web Console" available in your vSphere Web Client.

As previously indicated, if you previously changed the configuration to use the "legacy connection mode", you'll have to remove the custom configuration on your workstation, refer to the note below for more information.

Jan 6, 18:12 UTC
Update - We'll get back to you as soon as we have more information.

Jan 6, 18:10 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 08/12/2022 09:00 UTC
User impact : VMware Remote Console (VMRC) in "legacy connection mode" (cf https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/76672) is not working anymore with last Hosted Private Cloud infrastructure upgrades.
Root cause : A configuration change on the "SSL gateway" (the machine that acts as a bridge & firewall between your Hosted Private Cloud and the internet and allows you to connect to the vSphere web client among others things) required to adress the VMSA-2022-0030 pulished in december https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2022-0030.html
Workaround : We are actively working on a solution to bring back VMRC. In the meantime, you can use the "Web Console" available in your vSphere Web Client.

Note : We will probably not bring back the VMRC "legacy connection mode" (port 902) because it conflicts with the configuration change required to adress the VMSA-2022-0030. Instead, we are currently working on a solution to allow the VMRC "standard connection mode" (port 443). Once deployed, if you previously used the "legacy connection mode" you'll have to remove the custom configuration on your workstation, refer to "Resolution" section of this VMware guide : https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/76672 to find the lines to remove.

Ongoing Actions: Our teams are working with our provider to solve this problem.
